data.title: Male japanese singers? Help prease
data.meta_description: ?????Soompi's probably not the best place to ask this, but why not... I like singers/bands like Exile, Deep/Color, Hirai Ken, Mr.Children, Chemistry, etc... not really idol JE stuff, wannabe punk, visual kei, etc. I've listened to some stuff by Shimizu Shota, but I don't like his voice. :/ There ...
data.text:
?????Soompi's probably not the best place to ask this, but why not...

I like singers/bands like Exile, Deep/Color, Hirai Ken, Mr.Children, Chemistry, etc...

not really idol JE stuff, wannabe punk, visual kei, etc.

I've listened to some stuff by Shimizu Shota, but I don't like his voice. :/

There seems to be a lack in ballad singers too.

I really like female singers like alan. There's gotta be a male version of her somewhere? LOL

thx

JE groups are a bad representation of J-pop, sorry to anyone that likes them.

I mostly listen to Japanese R&B, some artists I like:

Dohzi-T: Duets with other artists

SPONTANIA: I love their song Kimi no Subete Ni~ They also have very nice collabs with some other good artists

Matsus-h-i-t-a Yuya (Sorry swear filter LOL)

M-FLO

Nerdhead

Hmm...I'll add more if I can think of any!

w-inds. is the one and only group i listen to and have been liking them for 5 years. lol

perhaps you can check out daichi miura?

JE groups are a bad representation of J-pop, sorry to anyone that likes them.

even though i dislike JE too.. haha! but i do think tegomasu's songs are nicer. a lot softer and sweeter. haha!

kanon wakeshima.. i find her songs really unique with the sound of biola.. i especially like her songs that are used in vampire knight OST. haha!

If you like Ryohei Yamamoto, I'd recommend blanc. (Maynard Plant from Monkey Majik) - I really like his solo style (nice mix of electro/lounge/rnb) a lot more than his work with his band. While you're at it, you should also check out his brother, Blaise Plant's solo material as well.

He's not really in the style of any of the guys you listed, but Leo Imai is very good if you're into electro/rock with solid vocals. Spitz for alternative/soft rock since you like Mr.Children. I'll assume you know who Shunsuke Kiyokiba is since you mentioned EXILE - his solo material is good. Well... at least his first album was.

...and the Gospellers like someone mentioned if you're into COLOR/Deep. I also recommend Toshinobu Kubota - the man's got soul and can definitely sing... too bad I'm not always into his music.

Actually if you're looking for good Japanese male singers who sing quality pop/ballads, it might be a good idea to check out 80s/early 90s stuff. That's where all the vocal talent lies. I really feel like it's all about the women in contemporary jpop - all the men are either in JE or in some kind of rock band.

Check out (a good portion of these guys are still releasing stuff):

Anzen Chitai (seriously, my favorite artist on this list)

Yosui Inoue

Kazumasa Oda

Masayoshi Yamazaki

Hideaki Tokunaga

Kozo Muras.hita

Takao Kisugi

Shogo Hamada

WANDS

Noriyuki Makihara

Kyosuke Himuro

Fumiya Fuji

Junichi Inagiki

I highly recommend flumpool! They have so many amazing songs, and their live shows are made of pure awesomeness! The songs I recommend are: labo, Hoshi ni Negai Wo, Hana ni Nare, Calling, and...bascially everything else. Genre: rock

You may also like Monkey Majik. They mix Japanese and English together. Listen to "Aitakute" it's such a pretty ballad. I also recommend I Miss You and Open Happiness. Genre: pop/rock

Greeeen is pretty good too. I love their song "Be Free."

Asian Kung-fu Generation is good, too. Their song for the movie Solanin, which also is the title for the song, is at the top of my current Itunes playlist. Rewrite is another good song of theirs.

If you like Exile, you may like UVERworld. Sora, Kimi no Suki na Uta, and endscape are some of my favorites of their songs.

Shouta Shimizu has an amazing voice. His songs are mostly R&B/pop. Of his songs, I like Forever Love, Home, and One Last Kiss.

One last artist pimp is for Weaver. They incorporate a piano into thier songs, which is pretty unique for a rock band. Their song "Hard to Say I Love You," was the theme song for the J-drama Sunao ni Narenakute.

Hopefully this helps! : )
